response:
Right lower motor neuron facial weakness, right-sided limb and gait ataxia with gaze-evoked horizontal nystagmus, and predominantly left-sided but partly bilateral pyramidal signs in the limbs without cortical features are best explained by a single lesion in the right lateral pons involving the facial nerve nucleus/fascicle, middle cerebellar peduncle, and descending corticospinal tracts.

lesion_locations = ["right pons"]
